class.name: PopupMenu
class.brief_description: PopupMenu displays a list of options.
class.description: [PopupMenu] is a [Control] that displays a list of options. They are popular in toolbars or context menus. The size of a [PopupMenu] can be limited by using [member Window.max_size]. If the height of the list of items is larger than the maximum height of the [PopupMenu], a [ScrollContainer] within the popup will allow the user to scroll the contents. If no maximum size is set, or if it is set to 0, the [PopupMenu] height will be limited by its parent rect.

method.name: add_check_item
method.description: Adds a new checkable item with text [code]label[/code]. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([code]accel[/code]). If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [code]accel[/code] is provided then the default [code]0[/code] will be assigned to it. See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_check_shortcut
method.description: Adds a new checkable item and assigns the specified [Shortcut] to it. Sets the label of the checkbox to the [Shortcut]'s name. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided. If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_icon_check_item
method.description: Adds a new checkable item with text [code]label[/code] and icon [code]texture[/code]. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([code]accel[/code]). If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [code]accel[/code] is provided then the default [code]0[/code] will be assigned to it. See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_icon_check_shortcut
method.description: Adds a new checkable item and assigns the specified [Shortcut] and icon [code]texture[/code] to it. Sets the label of the checkbox to the [Shortcut]'s name. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided. If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_icon_item
method.description: Adds a new item with text [code]label[/code] and icon [code]texture[/code]. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([code]accel[/code]). If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [code]accel[/code] is provided then the default [code]0[/code] will be assigned to it. See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators.

method.name: add_icon_radio_check_item
method.description: Same as [method add_icon_check_item], but uses a radio check button.

method.name: add_icon_radio_check_shortcut
method.description: Same as [method add_icon_check_shortcut], but uses a radio check button.

method.name: add_icon_shortcut
method.description: Adds a new item and assigns the specified [Shortcut] and icon [code]texture[/code] to it. Sets the label of the checkbox to the [Shortcut]'s name. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided. If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: add_item
method.description: Adds a new item with text [code]label[/code]. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([code]accel[/code]). If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [code]accel[/code] is provided then the default [code]0[/code] will be assigned to it. See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators.

method.name: add_multistate_item
method.description: Adds a new multistate item with text [code]label[/code]. Contrarily to normal binary items, multistate items can have more than two states, as defined by [code]max_states[/code]. Each press or activate of the item will increase the state by one. The default value is defined by [code]default_state[/code]. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([code]accel[/code]). If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [code]accel[/code] is provided then the default [code]0[/code] will be assigned to it. See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators.

method.name: add_radio_check_item
method.description: Adds a new radio check button with text [code]label[/code]. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided, as well as an accelerator ([code]accel[/code]). If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index. If no [code]accel[/code] is provided then the default [code]0[/code] will be assigned to it. See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_radio_check_shortcut
method.description: Adds a new radio check button and assigns a [Shortcut] to it. Sets the label of the checkbox to the [Shortcut]'s name. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided. If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually. See [method set_item_checked] for more info on how to control it.

method.name: add_separator
method.description: Adds a separator between items. Separators also occupy an index, which you can set by using the [code]id[/code] parameter. A [code]label[/code] can optionally be provided, which will appear at the center of the separator.

method.name: add_shortcut
method.description: Adds a [Shortcut]. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided. If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: add_submenu_item
method.description: Adds an item that will act as a submenu of the parent [PopupMenu] node when clicked. The [code]submenu[/code] argument is the name of the child [PopupMenu] node that will be shown when the item is clicked. An [code]id[/code] can optionally be provided. If no [code]id[/code] is provided, one will be created from the index.

method.name: clear
method.description: Removes all items from the [PopupMenu].

method.name: clear_item_opentype_features
method.description: Removes all OpenType features form the item's text.

method.name: get_current_index
method.description: Returns the index of the currently focused item. Returns [code]-1[/code] if no item is focused.

method.name: get_item_accelerator
method.description: Returns the accelerator of the item at index [code]idx[/code]. Accelerators are special combinations of keys that activate the item, no matter which control is focused.

method.name: get_item_icon
method.description: Returns the icon of the item at index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: get_item_id
method.description: Returns the id of the item at index [code]idx[/code]. [code]id[/code] can be manually assigned, while index can not.

method.name: get_item_index
method.description: Returns the index of the item containing the specified [code]id[/code]. Index is automatically assigned to each item by the engine. Index can not be set manually.

method.name: get_item_language
method.description: Returns item's text language code.

method.name: get_item_metadata
method.description: Returns the metadata of the specified item, which might be of any type. You can set it with [method set_item_metadata], which provides a simple way of assigning context data to items.

method.name: get_item_opentype_feature
method.description: Returns OpenType feature [code]tag[/code] of the item's text.

method.name: get_item_shortcut
method.description: Returns the [Shortcut] associated with the specified [code]idx[/code] item.

method.name: get_item_submenu
method.description: Returns the submenu name of the item at index [code]idx[/code]. See [method add_submenu_item] for more info on how to add a submenu.

method.name: get_item_text
method.description: Returns the text of the item at index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: get_item_text_direction
method.description: Returns item's text base writing direction.

method.name: get_item_tooltip
method.description: Returns the tooltip associated with the specified index index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: is_item_checkable
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the item at index [code]idx[/code] is checkable in some way, i.e. if it has a checkbox or radio button. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark or radio button, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: is_item_checked
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the item at index [code]idx[/code] is checked.

method.name: is_item_disabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the item at index [code]idx[/code] is disabled. When it is disabled it can't be selected, or its action invoked. See [method set_item_disabled] for more info on how to disable an item.

method.name: is_item_radio_checkable
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the item at index [code]idx[/code] has radio button-style checkability. [b]Note:[/b] This is purely cosmetic; you must add the logic for checking/unchecking items in radio groups.

method.name: is_item_separator
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the item is a separator. If it is, it will be displayed as a line. See [method add_separator] for more info on how to add a separator.

method.name: is_item_shortcut_disabled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the specified item's shortcut is disabled.

method.name: remove_item
method.description: Removes the item at index [code]idx[/code] from the menu. [b]Note:[/b] The indices of items after the removed item will be shifted by one.

method.name: set_item_accelerator
method.description: Sets the accelerator of the item at index [code]idx[/code]. Accelerators are special combinations of keys that activate the item, no matter which control is focused.

method.name: set_item_as_checkable
method.description: Sets whether the item at index [code]idx[/code] has a checkbox. If [code]false[/code], sets the type of the item to plain text. [b]Note:[/b] Checkable items just display a checkmark, but don't have any built-in checking behavior and must be checked/unchecked manually.

method.name: set_item_as_radio_checkable
method.description: Sets the type of the item at the specified index [code]idx[/code] to radio button. If [code]false[/code], sets the type of the item to plain text.

method.name: set_item_as_separator
method.description: Mark the item at index [code]idx[/code] as a separator, which means that it would be displayed as a line. If [code]false[/code], sets the type of the item to plain text.

method.name: set_item_checked
method.description: Sets the checkstate status of the item at index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: set_item_disabled
method.description: Enables/disables the item at index [code]idx[/code]. When it is disabled, it can't be selected and its action can't be invoked.

method.name: set_item_icon
method.description: Replaces the [Texture2D] icon of the specified [code]idx[/code].

method.name: set_item_id
method.description: Sets the [code]id[/code] of the item at index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: set_item_language
method.description: Sets language code of item's text used for line-breaking and text shaping algorithms, if left empty current locale is used instead.

method.name: set_item_metadata
method.description: Sets the metadata of an item, which may be of any type. You can later get it with [method get_item_metadata], which provides a simple way of assigning context data to items.

method.name: set_item_multistate
method.description: Sets the state of a multistate item. See [method add_multistate_item] for details.

method.name: set_item_opentype_feature
method.description: Sets OpenType feature [code]tag[/code] for the item's text. More info: [url=https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/typography/opentype/spec/featuretags]OpenType feature tags[/url].

method.name: set_item_shortcut
method.description: Sets a [Shortcut] for the specified item [code]idx[/code].

method.name: set_item_shortcut_disabled
method.description: Disables the [Shortcut] of the specified index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: set_item_submenu
method.description: Sets the submenu of the item at index [code]idx[/code]. The submenu is the name of a child [PopupMenu] node that would be shown when the item is clicked.

method.name: set_item_text
method.description: Sets the text of the item at index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: set_item_text_direction
method.description: Sets item's text base writing direction.

method.name: set_item_tooltip
method.description: Sets the [String] tooltip of the item at the specified index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: toggle_item_checked
method.description: Toggles the check state of the item of the specified index [code]idx[/code].

method.name: toggle_item_multistate
method.description: Cycle to the next state of a multistate item. See [method add_multistate_item] for details.

members.member: If [code]true[/code], allows navigating [PopupMenu] with letter keys.
If [code]true[/code], hides the [PopupMenu] when a checkbox or radio button is selected.
If [code]true[/code], hides the [PopupMenu] when an item is selected.
If [code]true[/code], hides the [PopupMenu] when a state item is selected.
The number of items currently in the list.

Sets the delay time in seconds for the submenu item to popup on mouse hovering. If the popup menu is added as a child of another (acting as a submenu), it will inherit the delay time of the parent menu item.

signal.name: id_focused
signal.description: Emitted when user navigated to an item of some [code]id[/code] using [code]ui_up[/code] or [code]ui_down[/code] action.

signal.name: id_pressed
signal.description: Emitted when an item of some [code]id[/code] is pressed or its accelerator is activated.

signal.name: index_pressed
signal.description: Emitted when an item of some [code]index[/code] is pressed or its accelerator is activated.

theme_items.theme_item: The text [Color] used for shortcuts and accelerators that show next to the menu item name when defined. See [method get_item_accelerator] for more info on accelerators.
The default text [Color] for menu items' names.
[Color] used for disabled menu items' text.
[Color] used for the hovered text.
The tint of text outline of the menu item.
[Color] used for labeled separators' text. See [method add_separator].
The horizontal space between the item's name and the shortcut text/submenu arrow.
The size of the item text outline.
The vertical space between each menu item.
[Font] used for the menu items.
Font size of the menu items.
[Texture2D] icon for the checked checkbox items.
[Texture2D] icon for the checked radio button items.
[Texture2D] icon for the unchecked radio button items.
[Texture2D] icon for the submenu arrow (for left-to-right layouts).
[Texture2D] icon for the submenu arrow (for right-to-left layouts).
[Texture2D] icon for the unchecked checkbox items.
[StyleBox] displayed when the [PopupMenu] item is hovered.
[StyleBox] for the left side of labeled separator. See [method add_separator].
[StyleBox] for the right side of labeled separator. See [method add_separator].
Default [StyleBox] of the [PopupMenu] items.
[StyleBox] used when the [PopupMenu] item is disabled.
[StyleBox] used for the separators. See [method add_separator].
